title: Compound Interest Calculator
subtitle: Calculate your investment growth with monthly contributions

compoundInterest.title: Compound Interest
compoundInterest.description: Interest is calculated on the initial value plus previously accumulated interest, creating an exponential effect.
compoundInterest.example: Example: $1000 at 1% per month = $1010 in the first month, $1020.10 in the second month.

monthlyContributions.title: Monthly Contributions
monthlyContributions.description: Each monthly contribution also earns compound interest from the following month.
monthlyContributions.example: The earlier you contribute, the more time the value will have to grow.

annualRate.title: Annual Rate
annualRate.description: The informed rate is converted to monthly (divided by 12) for precise calculation.

timepower.title: Power of Time
timepower.description: Time is the most important factor in compound interest - the longer the time, the greater the exponential growth.
timepower.example: Einstein said: "Compound interest is the eighth wonder of the world".

errors.general: Enter at least an initial value or monthly contribution
errors.initialValue: The initial value cannot be negative
errors.monthlyValue: The monthly contribution cannot be negative

interestRate.required: The interest rate must be greater than zero
interestRate.max: The interest rate cannot be greater than 100%

period.required: Enter a period greater than zero months
period.max: The period cannot be greater than 600 months (50 years)
